newsitem.title: USA: Metal says to acquire Cozzi Iron.
newsitem.headline: Metal says to acquire Cozzi Iron.

text.p: Metal Management Inc said it signed a definitive agreement to acquire Cozzi Iron & Metal Inc and its interests in two joint ventures for $6 million in cash and 11.5 million Metal shares.
Both companies are Chicago-based scrap metal handlers.
Brothers Albert and Frank Cozzi will join Metal's senior executive team and its board, Metal said.
Albert Cozzi will be president and the chief operating officer of the merged companies, Metal said.
Benjamin Jennings will be chairman and Gerard Jacobs will remain chief executive of the merged companies.

At closing, Albert, Frank and Greg Cozzi, as well as Jennings and Jacobs, will enter into five-year employment agreements which will, among other things, grant warrants to purchase an aggregate of three million shares of the company's common stock, Metal said.

Half the warrants issued will be exercisable at $5.91 per share and the other half will be exercisable at a price equal to 75 percent of the stock's closing price on the day before the closing of the Cozzi merger, Metal said.
In addition, Albert, Frank and Greg Cozzi and Jennings and Jacobs will enter into a 10-year agreement to, among other things, vote their shares together in certain circumstances.

"When the Cozzi merger is completed, these five individuals will own, directly or indirectly, approximately 16 million shares of the company's common stock on a fully diluted basis. Giving effect to the Cozzi merger, as of today the company would have approximately 30 million shares of common stock on a fully-diluted basis," Metal said.
